subject: Entrepreneurship
title: The Entrepreneurial Identity: Who Becomes a Founder?
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Entrepreneurial Identity: Who Becomes a Founder?.

hook.text: The myth says entrepreneurs are born risk-takers. Research says they're mostly dissatisfied employees.

buildup.text: Studies reveal founders share traits: need for autonomy, high openness, and internal locus of control.

discovery.text: Internal locus of control means believing you shape your outcomes, not luck or fate.

twist.text: Personality alone doesn't predict success. Context mattersâ€”immigrants and outsiders consistently overperform.

climax.text: The average successful founder is 45, not 25. Experience beats youthful energy in the data.

punchline.text: Founders aren't a type. They're a decision.

quiz.question: What does research say about the average age of successful founders?
options: They tend to be around 45, not in their twenties
Age has no correlation with startup success
